name: Wo Hop Chinatown | Wo Hop Restaurant | New York
tagline: The official website of the famous Wo Hop Restaurant at 17 Mott St. in New York City's Chinatown. Since 1938

sections.title:
January 29th marks the beginning of Lunar New Year 4723

THE YEAR OF THE SNAKE
sections.body:
January 29th marks the beginning of Lunar New Year 4723

THE YEAR OF THE SNAKE

sections.title: Our History goes back to 1938
sections.body: Our History goes back to 1938Now in its third generation of ownership, Wo Hop continues to be the go-to Chinese restaurant in Chinatown. We serve "old-fashioned chop suey style food. Americans like this style and not very many restaurants in Chinatown sell it anymore." We have some of the most dedicated customers around. Some come weekly and even daily. It's fast casual dining and delicious. We have a huge tourist customer base since they love to spread the word to their family and friends when they return home and via posts on Yelp and Facebook. No frills here, just reliable tasty food!

sections.title: Our History goes back to 1938
sections.body: Our History goes back to 1938Now in its third generation of ownership, Wo Hop continues to be the go-to Chinese restaurant in Chinatown. We serve "old-fashioned chop suey style food. Americans like this style and not very many restaurants in Chinatown sell it anymore." We have some of the most dedicated customers around. Some come weekly and even daily. It's fast casual dining and delicious. We have a huge tourist customer base since they love to spread the word to their family and friends when they return home and via posts on Yelp and Facebook. No frills here, just reliable tasty food!

sections.title: Read Our Reviews
sections.body:
Read Our ReviewsFrom Gothamist August 2020

"the original Wo Hop (the neighborhood's second oldest restaurant, behind Nom Wah) and the younger Wo Hop City, are now back in action"

https://gothamist.com/food/chinatown-classic-wo-hop-reopens-mott-streets-new-outdoor-dining-haven?mc_cid=e071afa8df

​

From The New York Times July 2010

"It is what New Yorkers used to know as a Chinese restaurant, serving an Americanized version of Chinese food, an authentic taste of an inauthentic past."

https://www.nytimes.com/2010/07/07/dining/reviews/07dinbriefs.html

​

From Medium.com July 2019

"Wo Hop continues to be a successful restaurant where tourists congregate."

https://medium.com/@anjipatel16/passing-down-the-family-business-a51e40830b76

​

From Youtube (cheyology)April 2019

WO HOP | New York's oldest Chinese Restaurant | What I ate this Wednesday

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=f6cJZ2jF-wE

​

From Tasteatlas.com

https://www.tasteatlas.com/wohop

​

From BrunchwithSam.com

https://www.brunchwithsam.com/single-post/everyone-wants-a-24-hour-chinese-restaurant

​

From Bizjournals.com November 2015

https://www.bizjournals.com/newyork/news/2015/11/11/wo-hops-chinatown-survival-secrets-chop-suey-cheap.html

​

From Seriouseats.com August 2018

https://newyork.seriouseats.com/2011/01/in-the-midnight-hour-wo-hop.htmlReady To Eat?SEE MENUORDER NOWBack to Top
